intro: Draba laxa var. legitima, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces slender, branching stems. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Draba laxa var. legitima is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
